ARABIC: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Eat and drink with relish for what you did before in days gone by!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (And told:) "Eat and drink to your fill as reward for (good) deeds you had done in days of yore."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (They will be told): “Eat and drink with good cheer as a reward for the good deeds you did in the days that have passed by.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Such people will be told, "Eat and drink with pleasure as the reward for what you did in the past".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Eat and drink with pleasure – the reward of what you sent ahead, in the past days.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Eat and drink at ease for that which you have sent on before you in days past!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Eat and drink pleasantly for what you did beforehand in the days gone by.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Eat and drink with wholesome appetite for that you did long ago, in the days gone by.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (And it will be said unto those therein): Eat and drink at ease for that which ye sent on before you in past days.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We shall say to him, "Eat and drink joyfully as a reward for the good deeds you did in days gone by."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Eat and drink with benefit for that which ye sent on beforehand in dayspast.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [He will be told]: ‘Enjoy your food and drink, for what you had sent in advance in past days [for your future life].’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Eat ye and drink ye, with full satisfaction; because of the (good) that ye sent before you, in the days that are gone!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Eat and drink at ease for that which you have sent on before you in days past!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (It will be said): 'Eat and drink with a good appetite because of what you did in days long passed'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “Eat and drink merrily for what you did in the days gone by.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:24] And so it will be said to them: ‘Eat and drink in enjoyment (hanī’an is a circumstantial qualifier, that is to say, mutahanni’īna, ‘while you are enjoying [them]’) for what you did in advance in former days’, [in days] that have passed during the [life of the] world.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Allah will say to them: (Eat) of the fruits (and drink) from the rivers (at ease) fearing no sickness or death (for that which ye sent on before you) for that which you did of righteous works; and it is also said this means: for the fasting and prayers you offered, (in past days) i.e. in the days of the life of the world.
